textBeforeTable: Faculty performance will be evaluated in the three areas of research, teaching and service, according to the following scale, recommended by the University Compensation Committee.   Faculty weights for the three areas of faculty accomplishment, teaching, research, and service, are negotiated between the faculty member and the department head according to guidelines established by the college. Faculty with a teaching load reduced below the norm (e.g., a six-hour teaching load to compensate for other assigned duties) will be allowed to negotiate these weights outside the normal college guidelines. Note that in such circumstances, there is a commensurately higher expectation of performance in the category for which the reduced teaching load was granted.   (Amended October 2008) Compensation Plan Criteria in Research, Teaching and Service Economics Department Economics Missouri State > College of Humanities and Public Affairs > College Compensation Plans > Economics College of Humanities and Public Affairs
